abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Education Sector Support Program is to assist the Government
            in the implementation of the Kenya Education Sector
            Strategic Plan (KESSP), and, as part of the process for
            attaining the KESSP goals, the project seeks to raise the
            net primary enrollment rate to at least 85 percent for boys
            and girls, and to raise the net primary enrollment rate in
            the North-Eastern Province to 25 percent; to raise the
            primary completion rate to 65 percent; to increase the
            number of secondary school places by 5 percent; to improve
            the education spending efficiency, as well as increase
            opportunities at the basic level; and, to establish an
            agreed policy framework for the Technical, Industrial,
            Vocational and Entrepreneurship Training (TIVET) and higher
            education sub-sectors. It is foreseen however, that the
            construction of schools and facilities, will pose adverse
            environmental effects, thus this environmental assessment
            presents mitigation measures as follows. Minimum design
            standards will be ensured, to include latrines, boarding
            accommodations, and school fencing and other security
            measures. Construction contractors shall comply with
            standards, as per precautionary clauses included in the
            technical specifications. Integrated water resources
            management should be promoted, to include as well rainwater
            harvesting. Capacity building should particularly target the
            needs of communities to mainstream their specific needs, in
            particular, those of underperforming students, orphans, and
            vulnerable children, or those affected by HIV/AIDS, and
            vulnerable groups. Likewise, capacity building shall focus
            on: obtaining land titles as needed; community mobilization;
            fundraising; liaisons with nongovernmental organizations and
            the private sector. Public awareness and sensitization
            campaigns should be promoted to inform communities,
            particularly in arid and semi-arid lands highlighting
            pastoral issues and needs. Participatory approaches should
            be built-in to involve stakeholders, as part of the
            field-based monitoring process to be implemented. Adequate
            water supply should be installed to provide hygienic
            standards in schools. Water quality should be regularly
            monitored, and water purification programmes should be
            initiated as required.
